==Trivia==
* The English name of the shop uses the native reading ''mono'' for the suffix of the shop {{zh|物|lit=thing,}} whereas the Japanese version uses its Sino-Japanese reading ''butsu''.
* The Chinese and Japanese name of the shop {{ja|九十九物|lit=Ninety Nine Things}} may be an allusion to ''{{w|tsukumogami}}'', or spirits in the Japanese folklore who are said to dwell in aged objects.
